alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Dawson; Forsyth; Gilmer; Lumpkin; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 12:24PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherokee, northwestern Forsyth, west central Lumpkin, southeastern Gilmer, western Dawson and eastern Pickens Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1224 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Roy to Lake Tamarack to near Waleska, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Ball Ground, Nelson, Amicalola Falls State Park, Sequoyah Lake, Camp Merrill, Marblehill, Juno, Fausett Lake, Len Foote Hike Inn, Cartecay, Black Gap Shelter, Lake Tamarack, Hollis Lathem Reservoir, Tate, Reavis Mountain, Nimblewill, and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Dawson; Forsyth; Gilmer; Lumpkin; Pickens
